Description: Glass necklace of 45 beads; two blue glass ornaments; gold pendants of religious significance; central pendant is of vase on altar flanked by two uraeui (sacred serpents of Egypt); the crescent and discs may signify new and full moon.
Bibliographic references: Jewellery / Catalogue of the Jewellery, Greek, Etruscan, and Roman, in the Departments of Antiquities, British Museum. (1547)
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 1991 22 Mar-21 Apr, Italy, Rome, Head Office of the Fondazione Oriele Sotgiu, I Gioielli Di Tharros 1990 13 Dec-1991 22 Mar, Italy, Oristano, Museo Archeologico Antiquarium Arborense (Palazzo Parpaglia), I Gioielli Di Tharros
